title: EU Artificial Intelligence Act
citation: Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council laying down harmonised rules on Artificial Intelligence

paragraphs.text: Prohibits manipulative, exploitative, social scoring and certain real-time biometric identification systems.
points: Real-time biometric identification for law enforcement with narrow exceptions

paragraphs.text: High-risk systems require a continuous, iterative risk management system covering identification, analysis, evaluation and mitigation of risks.
Training, validation and testing data must be subject to robust data governance and management practices.
High-risk AI systems must include effective human oversight.
points: Operators must understand system capabilities and limitations
Enable intervention to override or disable the system

paragraphs.text: Providers must prepare technical documentation before placing systems on the market or into service.

articles.label: Article 52
articles.title: Transparency obligations for certain AI systems

paragraphs.text: Users must inform individuals that they are interacting with an AI system, unless obvious.
Users must notify individuals when emotion recognition or biometric categorisation systems are used.
Member States shall ensure cooperation between competent authorities, including information exchange and mutual assistance.
